content:
Diagnosis:		August 2020 Prostate adenocarcinoma, initial PSA 24, pT3A Gleason 4+3=7 N0M0

Treatment:		August 2020 - Robotic-assisted radical prostatectomy at [redacted name] Hospital
			Post-operative PSA 0.8, imaging showed probable pelvic nodal disease
			October 2020 - Salvage radiotherapy to prostate bed and pelvic nodes
			(66Gy in 33 fractions) completed
			September 2021 - PSA rising to 0.92
			February 2022 - PSA 18.4, CT demonstrated multiple liver metastases
			Histologically confirmed on ultrasound-guided biopsy
			February 2022 - Initiated androgen deprivation therapy
			March 2022 - Commenced docetaxel chemotherapy
			Enrolled in PARAMOUNT clinical trial
			September 2022 - Completed 6 cycles docetaxel

Current situation:	PSA 0.04
			Maintaining response on ADT and darolutamide within PARAMOUNT study

I reviewed [redacted name] in clinic today. His clinical condition remains excellent.

Today's PSA results are pending but his previous reading showed continued biochemical response. Liver function tests and full blood count are within normal range.

He reports occasional peripheral neuropathy affecting his feet, likely residual from previous chemotherapy, which is adequately controlled with gabapentin.

I have provided a prescription for ongoing darolutamide and planned review in clinic in 3 months with interval PSA monitoring.

cancer_timeline.value: Salvage radiotherapy to prostate bed and pelvic nodes (66Gy in 33 fractions)
CT demonstrated multiple liver metastases, histologically confirmed on ultrasound-guided biopsy

patient_facts.value: occasional peripheral neuropathy affecting feet, likely residual from previous chemotherapy
Liver function tests and full blood count within normal range

status_updates.value: Metastatic prostate cancer with liver involvement, good response to docetaxel and maintaining response on ADT and darolutamide within clinical trial. Excellent clinical condition with stable PSA and manageable chemotherapy-related neuropathy.
maintaining response on ADT and darolutamide within PARAMOUNT study
planned review in clinic in 3 months with interval PSA monitoring
